Reviews.Title: “There are better choices in Dallas...”
Reviews.Author: mragan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights for a corporate event. As far as the hotel goes, the rooms are recently renovated, but the rooms still look shabby. There was mold in my bathroom, for example. Also, the rooms were wallpapered with a dark cranberry color, making it hard to see. The bathroom was black, which was also impossible to see in. The front desk staff were helpful and courteous. As for the conference services, the staff was very attentive. The meals were presented on time and were delicious. The only complaint is that we couldn't get he temperature at a comfortable level. The hotel is close to Mockingbird Station, which is a quick 15 minute ride to the West End. There is also a shopping area nearby with stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Poor wifi...great rooms...got lost walking around...”
Reviews.Author: skidoo44
Reviews.Content: CLC rate again, we paid 57 bucks. Remodel going on and the rooms are nice. They need more signs and to make more coffee....they ran out by 8 by the front desk and never got more!! Bar was clean, rooms were great, never ate. Good locatn if you are going to a game or downtown like us. 10 mins from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly melted!”
Reviews.Author: Suetheshark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and although the staff were all very friendly and helpful (especially reception, bar and morning breakfast people) and there was an outdoor pool, the hotel was somewhat 'challenged' on several fronts. Nothing wrong with the decor and the food was OK but...mid June in SW USA was more than a little hot this year and this hotel hasn't looked at its carbon footprint for many a year. The sun came up at 6.30am and within a short time, the sun reflected off the very large glass building opposite and threw copious radiation onto the windows. So hot that you could not touch them. Thus for most of the week or so there I lived in a darkened room with the curtains shut! They need to spray with anti-UV or something. On top of that, the air-conditioners were old and either did not cope or were so noisy as to make sleep impossible (I changed rooms at least twice trying to find one cool and silent enough. unfortunately even when one was found the air-con directed straight at the desk and so you chilled (but not in a nice way) trying to do work). To add yet more to the list, the 5 or 6-lane highway outside made most rooms on the road side impossible as noise went on through the night. IF I stay there again (and it is close to SMU) ear plugs should be supplied...

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad restaurant”
Reviews.Author: nosluap57
Reviews.Content: Check in - Staff appeared disinterested. Initially only one clerk, who seemed more interested conducting a telephone conversation. As that call ended, he was joined by a second clerk, who while serving me, was interrupted by another call. Nothing more was said to me explaining details of my visit (breakfast, facilities, etc.) other than my room number. Unable to locate a luggage cart for use. Inquired at the desk, and was told they were all in use. Waited ten minutes then gave up. By chance later in the day I seen hotel staff locking them into a room near the front desk. Why do they hide them? Rooms - have outdated CRT televisions. Control unit for Sleep Number bed did not display settings. Room had an off smell to it. Hot water in sink nearly scalded my wife's hands. Restaurant - Items on buffet were almost all cold. No fresh fruit available, only processed and canned. No jelly for biscuits or toast. Overpriced for what you get. Checkout - waited in line for over 25 minutes. Several people ahead of me, but only one clerk behind the counter. Overall an unsatisfactory experience. I was visiting as part of a group which had booked the entire hotel. I would never choose to stay at this hotel if not for being part of that group.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is very friendly”
Reviews.Author: JTScout
Reviews.Content: This Radisson is currently in the middle of a renovation. The tower appears to be near completion. The rooms in the tower are very comfortable and all have the sleep number bed. The wireless internet access is good in all of the rooms. The showers are not that good. The water pressure is low and the water tempurature does not go much past mildly warm. The best part of the stay will be the staff. They are very friendly and treat each guest with respect. The restuarant is okay and will suffice when you do not feel like going out to eat. One caution. The hotel is not in a desirable neighborhood. Radisson employes a security guard for evenings but it stil behooves you to take precaution when arriving or departing after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst experience of my life. The bedding was exteremely poor (awoke every 20 minutes to remove the mattress pad from my ribcage), the location was dangerous and very unappealing day or night, and the manager was the worst example of a customer service representative I have ever had the displeasure of running into. Don't believe a word of their advertising....it is all false and you will be devasted when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Our group of about 500 was there from May 17-24. I could not have asked for a better hotel staff. Our group keeps late hours, so they did their best to satisfy our strange hours. Hotel was clean, service was excellent and friendly. Would recomend this hotel to any group. We have already arranged to be there next year. This hotel should be commended for their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is a very poorly run hotel unfortunately we found this out the night of our event we booked the Hotel ballroom for an event we were expecting about 300 people to attend and they did. the air kept going out in the ballroom and some of the rooms with the temp. outside at about 101degress many guests got rooms there, many complained that the Night Manager was rude and he was. there was a bad smell just outside the doors coming from a drain. the food was cold. the stage was too small for the band. the elevators were working only some of the time. people got stuck on the elevators. security persons were non existant. and the 2 constables were drinking. people were just coming in off the street and even statrted a fight with one of our guests. many guests left early due to the heat. I will never again stay at this place motel 6 would be a step up from this place!! they fell way short on the delivery of services!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dallas Mockingbird
HotelInfo.Address: 1893 W. Mockingbird Lane, Dallas, TX 75235 (Formerly Radisson)
